title: Samsung Galaxy S23 hacked two more times at Pwn2Own Toronto
description: Security researchers hacked the Samsung Galaxy S23 smartphone two more times on the second day of the Pwn2Own 2023 hacking competition in Toronto, Canada. [...]

title: Chilean telecom giant GTD hit by the Rorschach ransomware gang
description: Chile's Grupo GTD warns that a cyberattack has impacted its Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) platform, disrupting online services. [...]

title: Microsoft tests Windows 11 encrypted DNS server auto-discovery
description: Microsoft is testing support for the Discovery of Network-designated Resolvers (DNR) internet standard, which enables automated client-side discovery of encrypted DNS servers on local area networks. [...]

title: Flipper Zero can now spam Android, Windows users with Bluetooth alerts
description: A custom Flipper Zero firmware called 'Xtreme' has added a new feature to perform Bluetooth spam attacks on Android and Windows devices. [...]

title: Windows 11 to let admins mandate SMB encryption for outbound connections
description: Windows 11 will let admins mandate SMB client encryption for all outbound connections, starting with today's Windows 11 Insider Preview Build 25982 rolling out to Insiders in the Canary Channel. [...]

title: Seiko says ransomware attack exposed sensitive customer data
description: Japanese watchmaker Seiko has confirmed it suffered a Black Cat ransomware attack earlier this year, warning that the incident has led to a data breach, exposing sensitive customer, partner, and personnel information. [...]

title: Citrix Bleed exploit lets hackers hijack NetScaler accounts
description: A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit is released for the 'Citrix Bleed' vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2023-4966, that allows attackers to retrieve authentication session cookies from vulnerable Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway appliances. [...]

title: Ransomware isn’t going away – the problem is only getting worse
description: Ransomware incidents continue to grow at an alarming pace, targeting the enterprise and governments worldwide. Learn more from Specops Software on how ransomware gangs gain initial access to networks and how to protect against attacks. [...]

title: European govt email servers hacked using Roundcube zero-day
description: The Winter Vivern Russian hacking group has been exploiting a Roundcube Webmail zero-day since at least October 11 to attack European government entities and think tanks. [...]

title: VMware fixes critical code execution flaw in vCenter Server
description: VMware issued security updates to fix a critical vCenter Server vulnerability that can be exploited to gain remote code execution attacks on vulnerable servers. [...]
